paper_abstract: We use circular sequences to give an improved lower bound on the minimum number of (<= k)-sets in a set of points in general position. We then use this to show that if S is a set of n points in general position, then the number square(S) of convex quadrilaterals determined by the points in S is at least 0.37553((n)(4)) + O(n(3)). This in turn implies that the rectilinear crossing number cr(K(n)) of the complete graph K(n)is at least 0.37553((n)(4)) + O(n(3)), and that Sylvester's Four Point Problem Constant is at least 0.37553. These improved bounds refine results recently obtained by Abrego and Fernandez-Merchant and by Lovasz, Vesztergombi, Wagner, and Welzl.
paper_title: k-sets, convex quadrilaterals, and the rectilinear crossing number of K(n)
